result.execSummary:
The defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 14cf246 and any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Martin Bruflodt

Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
1:58 p.m. Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in custody.  Mary Margaret Sowinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf246 and 15cf250. RIchards statement to agreement/Sowinski concurs. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 2, 3, 5 and 6 in 14CF246 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest to Count 4 in 14cf246 and Count 1 in 15cf250.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Sowinski statement to compliance with victim rights legislation. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Sowinski/Richards/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cf246
Jail - 1 year - CS to any other sentence
Jail credit - 5 days
Court Costs remitted
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).

15cf250
Jail - 1 year CC to 14cf246 and any other sentence
Court Costs remitted

Appeal rights given. NADVI given. 
Adj. 2:21 p.m.
confirmed with Brian at ONSO that there is no detainer for him -

9:34 a.m. Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in court via video with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Joel Martin Bruflodt in custody in Stanley Correctional. Jillian Pfeifer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 14cf246 and 15cf250. Richards statement. Defendant has open cases in other counties in addition to Oneida County. In 15cf250 - Richards has not been appointed but does not forsee problems; believes he will be appointed.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived
. Court sets $1,000 signature bond. Richards requests matter be set for status conference in both cases - waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail continued in 14cf246. DA's office to prepare Order for Transport for next hearing. Adj. 9:40 a.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Electronic Filing Notice - "Forwarding time exp rtn to send Braflodt Jjoel M - 1005 Main St Ste 900" - balance unreadable
Per Jack at ONSO - detainer placed - Dodge Correctional Facility
Status hearing on March 21, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is still in ST. Croix county on 15CF370 and 15CF478 - cases are set for a status conference on 3/11 at 10:30.  Will check status of cases after 3/11.
per Mary- in Polk County on local charges - detainer placed

10:12 a.m. Steven Michlig appears for State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf250 and 14cf246. Court notes Notice of Hearing was mailed to Attorney Richards. Michlig states Mr. Bruflodt may be in custody in a different county. State moves for warrant to be issued. Court authorizes warrant. Adj. 10:14 am.
